title: How to stop being dependent on modern technology, such as a mobile phone or laptop - Quora

response.answer_text: This may be a time that you will have to monitor yourself. I would research methods other people have found successful. Know also that there doubtfully there will be a one stop solution. “Device” attachment is not your dilemma only and it does not sound like an easy mountain to climb. I began to implement small scale rules that helped my daughters..no cell phone texting in car...No phones at meals, things like that. I watched a cousin drive up from Florida for Thanksgiving but spent the entire visit on his phone. That “dog won’t hunt” here. Best of luck to you..I really wish you well.

you need to build resilience without it. Do you rely on your calendar on your phone? Keep a diary. Do you wake up to an alarm? When was the last time you woke up to your local area breakfast show? How many times do you send an email to your boss or colleagues? Go and talk to them and get their thoughts in real time. quite simply don't take the easy immediate response. Go and find the person don't just look for the mailbox

What should we do to be less dependent on technology? There is an entire movement of getting back to the land, making life simpler, getting rid of whatever technology you can. Research the Corporatism of Chesterton, Belloc, and Salazar, one time Prime Minister of Portugal. This view comes from the encyclical of Pope Leo XIII, RERUM NOVARUM, believe it or not! I would think that by getting back to the land, if possible, many technological ‘advances’ could be discarded, like cell phones, computers, electricity, cars, etc. If that is impossible for some, anything that makes life harder to bear or demands your constant attention can be abolished from your life! Since this would be on a case by case basis, great variety will be found. Lessening our dependence on technological inventions, can make us more independent, more human. Thus we can become more of a perceived threat to any as-is, or Politically Correct, view of humanity.

Depends on what is meant by being too dependent on technology. As it is now a prominent part of our life, it has its benefits as well as drawbacks. It can be quite a useful tool in many aspects of our lives. If being too addicted is what is meant, such as wasting too much time on WhatsApp or Facebook, I would set aside some time for yourself a day or place a time limit. Disconnecting the app may also be worth a shot, as each time you would be required to log in. Finding a new hobby or something that is important and has been pending might also help shift the focus.

You may be trying to do a King Canute and trying to stop the tide coming in. What ARE the consequences of your use of technology, REALLY? If you can identify a definite problem then just stop using it for a month completely and review the situation.
What constitutes too dependent. If you are shooting for “I’m OK if the trucks stop bringing food” that's a lot of work.
Try knitting when listening to podcasts. A very beautiful alternative to watching series when checking social media. Trust me, I tried both. Ps: Men knit too :)
